hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Warning via Solana Funding Rate Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During BULL regime, if SOL perpetual funding rate exceeds +0.05% (annualized 18+%) while SOL price fails to make new 3-day high, a short-term correction will occur within 48 hours, potentially triggering transition to NEUTRAL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme positive funding during price stagnation indicates overcrowded long positioning. This often precedes liquidation cascades as overleveraged positions get squeezed, cooling bullish momentum.
entry_conditions: SOL price < 3-day high despite high funding
SOL open interest increases while price stagnates

exit_conditions.take_profit: SOL price drops 8% or funding normalizes below +0.02%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: SOL makes new 3-day high with sustained high funding

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: High funding resolves through price breakout upward instead of correction.
